intro: Rodrigueziopsis eleutherosepala, commonly known as the Madagascar starwood, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy, and is characterized by its unique morphological features. The plant is distinguished by its star-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers, which are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from deforestation and climate change.
